caption:
The photograph features a close-up view of a person's hands filling out a form titled “OREGON DEPARTMENT OF FISH AND WILDLIFE.” The form is attached to a clipboard. The person is using a pen to write on the form, which appears to be a data recording sheet for fish damage surveys, specifically relating to damages by sea lions. The sheet includes columns titled 'Date,' 'Count,' 'Males,' 'Females,' 'Pups,' and 'Total.' The form displays a date at the top: "3/21/73."

The person’s hands and part of their lower arms are visible, showing detail such as skin texture and a wristwatch. The background of the image is a soft, out-of-focus bluish color, contributing to a faded vintage feel. Overall, the image captures a moment of detailed observational work or surveying in a natural resource management setting. The lighting in the image is soft, creating a somewhat moody atmosphere.
title: Member of the Oregon rats mountaineers' club filling in a snow survey form for the soil conservation service.  Survey is being carried out at the tilly jane campground on mt.  Hood.  Results will be used to predict amount of spring runoff into the Columbia River
